data_center.context: Includes AMD Instinct™ GPUs and AMD EPYC™ CPUs

drivers: Strong ramp of AMD Instinct™ GPU shipments
Growth in AMD Instinct™ GPU adoption by cloud and enterprise customers

MI300X.impact: Accelerated AI deployments across multiple platforms

drivers: Strong ramp of AMD EPYC™ CPU sales
Increased adoption of 5th Gen AMD EPYC™ CPUs in enterprise and cloud environments

EPYC_5th_Gen.impact: Increased adoption in enterprise and cloud environments

drivers: Strong demand for Zen 5 AMD Ryzen™ processors

zen_5.impact: Growth in notebook and desktop CPU sales

ryzen_9000_series.performance_improvement: Leadership productivity, gaming, and content creation performance
ryzen_9000_series.impact: Strong desktop and mobile CPU sales

ryzen_ai_pro_300_series.performance_improvement: Enterprise-class security, manageability, and AI capabilities
ryzen_ai_pro_300_series.impact: Adoption in CoPilot Plus PCs and commercial platforms

gaming.context: Includes discrete graphics processors and semi-custom game console products

drivers: Decrease in semi-custom revenue due to console cycle

so_c_sales.impact: Decline due to being in the fifth year of the console cycle

rdna_4_gpus.performance_improvement: Higher ray tracing performance and new AI capabilities
rdna_4_gpus.impact: Transition to next-gen Radeon GPUs, launch expected in early 2025

ps5_pro.description: PS5 Pro with AMD semi-custom SoC
ps5_pro.performance_improvement: Significant increases in graphics and ray tracing performance

embedded.context: Includes embedded products and adaptive computing solutions

drivers: Improved demand in several end markets

versal_premium_vp1902.description: Versal™ Premium VP1902 Adaptive SoC Gen Two
versal_premium_vp1902.performance_improvement: 3x increase in AI TOPS per watt
versal_premium_vp1902.impact: Enhanced AI capabilities across a broad range of products

telluride_soc.performance_improvement: Up to 10x more compute and enables AI application acceleration on a single chip
telluride_soc.impact: First product in second-gen Versal family

spartan_ultrascale.performance_improvement: High IO counts and power efficiency

total_expenses.context: Operating expenses including R&D, marketing, and other activities
key_factors: Increased investments in R&D to support product roadmaps and AI initiatives
Higher operating expenses to scale the business

R&D.context: Increased investments in research and development to support product roadmaps and AI initiatives

marketing.context: Enhanced go-to-market activities to support product launches and growth initiatives

amortization.context: Amortization of intangible assets associated with acquisitions

drivers: Higher revenue in Data Center and Client segments

eps.context: Diluted earnings per share for Q3 2024
eps.notes: Includes better-than-expected revenue and operating expenses

non_gaap_eps.context: Non-GAAP diluted earnings per share for Q3 2024

tax_rate.context: Effective tax rate for Q3 2024 and full year 2024

free_cash_flow.notes: Excluding certain nonrecurring payments related to acquisitions from operating cash flows

cash_from_operations.notes: Reflects strong financial model despite mixed demand environment

share_repurchase.context: Repurchased $250 million of common stock during Q3 2024

fourth_quarter_2024.additional_notes: Expect to close the acquisition of ZT Systems in the first half of 2025.

full_year_2024.revenue_growth_year_over_year: Expected based on roadmaps and strategic priorities
full_year_2024.context: Led by growth in Data Center and Client segments

product_introductions: MI400 series based on CDNA Next architecture
partnerships_and_adoptions: Microsoft adopting Instinct MI300X for GPT-4 Turbo and Copilot services
Meta deploying MI300 in AI workloads
Oracle deploying MI300 for database solutions
Subaru adopting Versal™ Premium VP1902 for EyeSight ADAS system
Stable Diffusion partnering to support SD 3.0 on MI300
Hugging Face supporting Llama 3.1 on MI300X
Broadcom, Cisco, HP Enterprise, Intel, Google, Meta, and Microsoft collaborating on Ultra Accelerator Link
Cloudflare selecting Genoa-X processors for next-gen servers
Google and OCI announcing plans to launch fifth-gen EPYC instances
ecosystem_support: Enhanced support for OpenAI Triton compiler
Collaborations with major AI software and cloud providers
Day 1 support for AMD hardware in new AI models and frameworks
ROCm 6.2 release improving MI300X inferencing performance
corporate_responsibility: Investments in sustainable technological and scientific advancements

operating_environment_challenges: Substantial inventory reduction across the PC supply chain

executive_comments.ceo_statement: “We delivered strong third quarter financial results with record revenue led by higher sales of EPYC and Instinct data center products and robust demand for our Ryzen PC processors,” said AMD Chair and CEO Dr. Lisa Su. “Looking forward, we see significant growth opportunities across our data center, client and embedded businesses driven by the insatiable demand for more compute.”
executive_comments.cfo_statement: “AMD executed well in the third quarter, delivering strong year-over-year expansion in gross margin and earnings per share,” said AMD EVP, CFO and Treasurer Jean Hu. "We are on-track to deliver record annual revenue for 2024 based on significant growth in our Data Center and Client segments.”
